amendment.description: Amendment sought to add a new section on findings relating to health benefits by highlighting data which demonstrates that if rules repealed by the bill were to remain in effect, they would yield annual public health benefits of between $6.7 billion and $18 billion, at a cost of under $1 billion.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in the Congressional Record to add a new section on findings relating to health benifits.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Edwards amendment (A016) Failed by recorded vote: 165 - 258 (Roll no. 762).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Edwards amendment (A016) Failed by recorded vote: 165 - 258 (Roll no. 762).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A016) offered by Ms. Edwards.
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
